intro: Convolvulus macrorhizus, commonly known as large-rooted morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae). It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink, purple, or white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and possesses a robust root system, which contributes to its ability to thrive in various soil types. Native to regions of Africa and the Middle East, it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential invasive species in certain environments.
